As a critical thinker, I would agree with your reasoning that investing in our youth's higher education, much like other countries, has benefits. For instance, who would bear the cost of making education free? Typically, it would be all taxpayers as proposed in certain models of free college education. Some individuals argue that this isn't fair for those who choose not to attend or those who already paid for their education. Anyway, agreeing that other countries invest in their youth, doesn't automatically mean implementing free college is the optimal solution for our country, considering the diverse education needs, financial realities, and social factors. So, while your reason holds some truth, the claim "College should be free" might require a more holistic evaluation with cost-benefit analysis and long-term planning.
